attributes.action: Request that the Royal Opera House Covent Garden, a publicly funded and taxpayer subsidised body, not raise ticket prices disproportionately, thereby making the Opera House inaccessible for young people, low wage earners and students.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
For the 2008/09 season of the Royal Opera House, for performances of La Boheme and Don Giovanni the Royal Opera House, for a Stalls Circle Standing place are charging £19 for a place, a rise from their price of £11 in previous seasons.

Some restricted view seats in the Amphitheatre which were previously £25 will be priced at £37.  For the Ballet for these same seats, these were priced at £11, these have now been raised to £27, a rise of 150%

In contrast the Orchestra Stalls have now 5 varieties in ranging from £195 to £150 and the top price is a slight rise from £165 to £195.

The regular patrons in the cheaper areas of the house are effectively paying for this flexibility in the more expensive areas and as a publicly funded body, should be held accountable for this price hike, which effectively prices people out of going to visit the Royal Opera House, making it an elitist, inaccessible and most expensive house in Europe if not the world.
